title: Coming Out Day
caption:
ğŸŒˆ Sunday 11 October is Coming Out Day. On that day, attention is paid to the moment a lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender or other person (LGBT+) openly expresses a sexual orientation or gender identity: â€˜coming outâ€™. This is not a one-off event, because a new context with new people always requires a new legitimation or acceptance of someone's gender and / or sexuality. A (first) coming out can therefore be personal and vulnerable, but it is often experienced as a relief afterwards. What does that mean?

In this video, 5 students share their opinion on Coming Out Dayâ¤ï¸

#comingoutday #lgbtq #lgbt #universityofamsterdam #uvapride
â›…ï¸ğŸ¤©

title: Hoe is het om nu te beginnen aan de studie?  Student Vlogs  Maaike  UvA
caption:
Hi!
Ik ben Maaike, ik ben 19 jaar en ik kom uit Nederland, maar ben ook half Canadees. Ik studeer de internationale track van Communication Science! Als je vragen hebt, dm mij op Instagram, @maaike_elisabeth!

Ben jij benieuwd hoe het onze eerstejaars afgaat? Kijk dan onze nieuwe serie studentenvlogs. Vier eerstejaarsstudenten delen hun ervaringen over het starten van een studie in deze gekke tijd. 

#StudentVlog #Universitylife #UniversityofAmsterdam

Both Bachelor's and Master's programmes at the UvA have considerably more first year students this year than last year, with 17% and 19% increases, respectively. We are now with more than 39,000 students! ğŸ¤©

Students are not just studying in Amsterdam right now, but all over the world. ğŸŒ We want to showcase some of your study spots in other countries. Share a photo of where you are studying (tag @uva_amsterdam or DM us) and we might share it in our stories! ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡®ğŸ‡³ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ

PS. This photo was taken last year, before the corona virus, by Bob Bronshoff

title: Matthijs Rooduijn (Political Scientist @ UvA) on the Dutch elections âœğŸ¼
caption:
Are the Dutch elections abracadabra for you? ğŸ¤·â€â™‚ï¸ Matthijs Rooduijn (Political Scientist at the UvA) answered three questions regarding Dutch politics and elections to help you understand better ğŸ™Œ

What kind of voting system do we have in the Netherlands? Which political parties take part in the elections and how do they relate to each other? What are the important developments during this specific election? Find out in this IGTV ğŸ‘
Weâ€™re always looking for ways to improve. Thatâ€™s why weâ€™d love to hear your thoughts on our Instagram account. Head over to our stories to answer some questionsğŸ•º

At the #uvaopenhouse you can get to know our programmes through various themes. Our new theme week is all about the brain ğŸ§ . 
We know a lot about it but thereâ€™s still so much that we donâ€™t knowğŸ¤·. More and more study programmes are concerned with it, for example those involving Big Data and AI. During this theme week, you will broaden your outlook and discover how different programmes, students and scientists all view the brain differently. Want to know more or register for online live sessions? Check our story or our link in bio ğŸ•º

Have you picked up any new hobbies during lockdown? ğŸ‘‹Meet Rick (student Business Administration) and his Corona hobby: learning Korean in part 4 of our hobby series.

Rick: â€œWhen I was younger and living abroad, I had no choice than to pick up the local language. Ever since, I am intrigued by the science of language learning. And in addition to that, I donâ€™t like feeling like a tourist when I am visiting a country ğŸ˜

I was supposed to go to South Korea after finishing my Bachelorâ€™s degree past summer, but unfortunately that did not happen. I would like to live and work there for at least a few years in the future. So, having an (basic) understanding of the language is only going to be beneficial. Therefore, I started learning Korean during the lockdown. And also because Chinese or Japanese seemed too difficult to me (for now), ha-ha. I believe language learning is good for personal development and widening your view on the world by understanding how different cultures work. The Korean language is pleasant to the ears because of the specific intonation and the avoidance of hard consonants like the infamous Dutch letter â€˜Gâ€™.

A quote I live by is â€œmind over matterâ€. I think itâ€™s more important than ever before to focus on the things you can control. See the positives in life like grabbing a coffee with a friend or going for a walk. Try to invest in yourself a little more during these difficult times.â€

Amazing ğŸ“¸ by @ilsoovandijk

Have you ever seen this name on the bridge while strolling to the M building? ğŸš¶â€â™‚ï¸

The bridge is named after Laura Mazirel, better known as "Lau". She was a resistance fighter in World War II and next to that she was an early proponent of LGBT rights and the rights of Romani people.

What is and what isnâ€™t possible on campusâ“And when can I go there?â“To answer these questions, weâ€™ve made an infographic. You can always find the latest updates and FAQâ€™s via www.uva.nl/coronavirus
A very popular lockdown activity is baking! ğŸ§ğŸª Today, we present in our stories all the beautiful creations our followers made during one of the lockdowns in the Great UvA Bake Off.

Maybe a little bit different than usual this year but that doesnâ€™t make graduating less special! ğŸ“ Congratulations to all students who attained their diploma in the middle of a pandemic ğŸ‰ You can be really proud of yourselves!

ğŸ“¸ Jasper ter Schetter

Are you an international student and interested in doing your Bachelor's or Master's in Amsterdam? At the #uvaopenhouse you can find out everything you need to know. This theme week is all about studying in Amsterdam âŒâŒâŒ

You can join live Q&A sessions with current UvA students from your part of the world ğŸ’¬, discover tips and helpful information and get a feel for student life in Amsterdam ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ“ Want to know more or register for the live Q&Aâ€™s? Check our story or link in bio.

ğŸ“¸ by @msivolap

Want to meet other new UvA students before your programme starts in September? Check out @uva.bios - a student-run Instagram account where you can meet other students and introduce yourself to everyone else! ğŸ‘

Check out our stories to see how last yearâ€™s new students found friends, relationships and more by connecting with each other through @uva.bios ğŸ˜Š

title: Moving in and cooking for the first time!  Student Vlogs  Leila  UvA
caption:
Hey everyone! 

My name is Leila, Iâ€™m 18, from Lebanon, studying Communication Science at the University of Amsterdam. Really excited to show you guys how my first year in the Netherlands goes, so I hope you enjoy my vlog series :D 

We are incredibly excited to share this new series of student vlogs with you!! Four first-year students have been documenting their experiences of coming to Amsterdam and starting their studies in the fall of 2020. As this academic year looks different compared to others we thought it would be interesting to see how students are experiencing this change. 

#StudentVlog #Universitylife #UniversityofAmsterdam

A sneak peek of the re-opening of the Allard Pierson Museum. The Allard Pierson manages and presents the heritage collections of the University of Amsterdam. You can travel through 10,000 years of cultural history in our 'From the Nile to the Amstel' exhibition. Or pay a visit at the first exhibition in the Netherlands devoted to the Art Nouveau fascination for the female figure. Students and researchers can also consult the heritage of the UvA in the Reading Hall.

Btw, thereâ€™s an nice espresso bar downstairs ğŸ˜Š.

UPDATE #coronavirus â— Check out the full update via our stories or the link in bio!

We are hoping for an announcement next week that students in higher education will be able to return to the UvA more often from 26 April onwards, but the government has postponed its decision on the matter. Preparations are being made, and we have some news about additional study spaces and how self-testing will work in the futureğŸ”®.
ğŸ”¹The University Library is working with the faculties to expand the number of study spaces at the various campuses. So when the measures are indeed relaxed a bit, this will allow us to safely offer the highest possible number of students a space. By now, 2,300 spaces have been created. We are also working on collaboration spaces where students will be able to work together in limited numbersğŸ“š.
ğŸ”¹A relaxation of the measures for higher education will go hand in hand with the provision of self-tests. We are currently working hard to make these testsğŸ§ª available to students and staff free of charge. At least two tests per person per week are scheduled to be available soon.
These will be available through Surfspot, with instructions on how to use them. 
ğŸ”¹Taking a self-test will always be voluntary. We will not check at the door whether you have taken one, nor will you have to show proof of a negative test. Other measures (1.5-metre, face masksğŸ˜·, etc.) will continue to apply.
However, we do hope that you consider taking a test before coming to the UvA. This will allow us all to contribute to a safe campus and possible further relaxations of the measures by the government.

Attention first year students! Dutch universities, including the UvA, are lowering the standard for BSA this year! ğŸ‘ŒğŸ» For the UvA, this means that students need 6 ECs less to continue to the next academic year. Find out more via our ğŸ”— in bio and let your friends know below â¬‡ï¸

title: First Online Exam + Exploring the city |Student Vlogs Week 4  Anna  UvA
caption:
Hey everyone! 

My nameâ€™s Anna, Iâ€™m 23, and Iâ€™m from the US! Over the next two years Iâ€™ll be getting a masterâ€™s in forensic science. Iâ€™m super excited to be participate in this vlog series  and to share my experience with you :) Stay tuned for more videos!

We are incredibly excited to share this new series of student vlogs with you!! Four first-year students have been documenting their experiences of coming to Amsterdam and starting their studies in the fall of 2020. As this academic year looks different compared to others we thought it would be interesting to see how students are experiencing this change. 

#StudentVlog #Universitylife #UniversityofAmsterdam

ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ Happy pride month! Weâ€™re more than happy to introduce you to @asvgay â€“ a student association focused on bringing together all LGBTQ+ students of Amsterdam through organising fun activities in a safe environment. Theyâ€™re the largest LGBTQ+ student association in the Netherlands ğŸ‘ Want to know more about them? Theyâ€™re taking over our IG stories for today! So take a look there or visit @asvgay for more info. 

#pridemonth #pride #lgbtq+
ğŸš¨New merch alert!ğŸš¨Sweatpants and socks are now online! Check out Black Friday deals in our online store â¡ï¸ 20% off everything ğŸŒŸFind the link in our story and bio. #blackfriday

Oudemanhuispoort is looking sunny today! â˜€ï¸ Do you know which statue is represented here? 

Please note that most of the UvA buildings are closed this Thursday and Friday, except for the University Library Single and the Library Learning Centre (REC-H) @uva_library â¡ï¸ You can check out the opening hours via our ğŸ”— in bio.

Say â€˜hiâ€™ our newest International Student Ambassadors! ğŸ‘‹ Wish you could ask current students what studying in Amsterdam as an international student is like? Hereâ€™s your chance! Head to our stories or link in bio and ask all your questions ğŸ’¬
Itâ€™s 28 degrees in Amsterdam! â˜€ï¸ How are you beating the heat today? ğŸ˜…

UPDATE #coronavirusâ—: The government announced additional measures until 20 October. There are no changes for education at the moment. The new rules with regard to group size - maximum 30 people inside and 40 people outside - do not apply to the education sector. This applies to in-person educationğŸ‘¥, student desks and librariesğŸ¢, graduation and diploma ceremoniesğŸ“ and study association activitiesğŸ“š. 
ğŸ”¹Events that are education- or research-related, such as small-scale symposia and graduation ceremonies, can take place; naturally the events protocol, relevant UvA protocols and RIVM guidelines continue to apply. Events that are not education or research-related will not be able to take place until at least 20 October. 
ğŸ”¹Everyone is asked to work from homeğŸ’», unless there is no other option. Exceptions to this are necessary activities that cannot be performed from home, such as scheduled in-person education, research and facilities management. Non-essential â€˜hybridâ€™ work will be phased out. For those who really cannot work from home, the (limited) possibility to come to campus remains, just as in March and April. 
ğŸ”¹UvA buildings are not open to the public and therefore there is no obligation to wear a maskğŸ˜·. We will continue to follow the current protocols, which guarantee that we can stay 1.5 m away from each other in UvA buildings. Employees and students are of course free to choose to wear a face mask. We will continue to be in contact with the safety region and other educational institutions on this subject. 
ğŸ”¹There is no travel advice specifically for the Amsterdam regionğŸšƒ. The familiar rules remain in force, both indoors and outdoors on campus: keep your distance from each other; use the stairs rather than the lifts if possible; reserve your study place and follow the instructions; walking routes; hygiene regulations. We will of course continue to strive to make as much as possible as we can for our students and employees under these difficult circumstances.

ğŸ‘€ Can you guess in whose office @studentenstemwijzer were preparing their interview? (Hint 1: it belongs a political party, hint 2: pay attention to the details)

Last week @studentenstemwijzer went to the political heart of the Netherlands, The Hague, to question more party leaders on topics that are important to students. We (and they) hope that these interviews will make it easier for you to make a choice on 17 March âœğŸ¼

Three new podcasts and interviews are available on Spotify and YouTube ğŸ’ƒ One of which was recorded in the room you see in the photo. Know whose room it is yet? Go to the link in bio or see our stories to find out which interviews were released last week and you'll probably be able to guess the answer! ğŸ‘

â˜€ï¸ The sun has finally reached Amsterdam. Visit our stories to discover an interactive map to explore the city. Let yourself be surprised by the to do tips by UvA students. Grab your sunglasses and enjoy the city ğŸ˜

What exactly do we celebrate today with the Dies Natalis? ğŸ¤” Anna GimbrÃ¨re gave us a short history class on the emergence of our university in the Dies broadcast. 

Want to check the whole broadcast? You can now rewatch it through the link in our bio ğŸ“º

Need some study inspiration? ğŸ’¡UvA student @_floralstudies has mastered the art of study planning ğŸ‘ŒğŸ“ She shares tips on taking notes during Zoom lectures, staying calm during stressful times, and listening to study playlists while creating awesome study notes ğŸ‘

(Ps. Got any study tips of your own? Share them below â¬‡ï¸)

Welcome to Hogwar.. ğŸ”®, uhhh the University of Amsterdam. Youâ€™re looking at the Bushuis which is located in the city center at Kloveniersburgwal. 

ğŸ› The Bushuis used to be a weapons warehouse in the 16th century. That is also where its name comes from. The word â€˜busâ€™ means cannon in Old Dutch. And the name â€˜Bushuisâ€™ equates to â€˜arsenalâ€™ which is a warehouse for war needs ğŸ’£ Now, the building has much more peaceful purpose: it houses the Faculty of Humanities.

title: Mijn Tweede Week op de Universiteit  Student Vlogs Week 3  Maaike  UvA
caption:
Hi!
Ik ben Maaike, ik ben 19 jaar en ik kom uit Nederland, maar ben ook half Canadees. Ik studeer de internationale track van Communication Science! Als je vragen hebt, dm mij op Instagram, @maaike_elisabeth!

Ben jij benieuwd hoe het onze eerstejaars afgaat? Kijk dan onze nieuwe serie studentenvlogs. Vier eerstejaarsstudenten delen hun ervaringen over het starten van een studie in deze gekke tijd. 

#StudentVlog #Universitylife #UniversityofAmsterdam

UPDATE #coronavirusâ—ï¸At the press conference on 13 October, the government announced additional measures to combat the coronavirus pandemicğŸ¦ . These will apply for at least the coming four weeks. Below, you can read more about how these measures will impact the University of Amsterdam (UvA).
ğŸ”¹In the short term, the government intends to make wearing face masks a legal requirement. At the UvA, this means that from now on, everyone will be wearing a face maskğŸ˜· in all indoor areas (corridors, lifts, halls, etc.) including the library until arriving at their destination. Once in a lecture room or office, face masks may be removed. If you prefer to continue wearing one, feel free to do so. In some spaces (e.g. laboratories)ğŸ¥¼ special guidelines apply, which take precedence over general UvA guidelines.
ğŸ”¹Teaching activities at universities are exempt to the rule that gatherings must be in groups of 30 and underğŸ§‘â€ğŸ«. Examinations can also continue without any group size limitations, although of course all the necessary precautionary measures will be taken. Study spacesğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’» will also remain available for use. Students will be informed when any scheduled activities are cancelled.
ğŸ”¹Teaching-related activities such as degree certificate and diploma award ceremoniesğŸ“ğŸ¥³ may continue, with a maximum of 30 people in attendance. In order to restrict travel as much as possible, considering any alternatives first, such as online options, is recommended. Unfortunately, a reception after the award ceremony is currently out of the question. 
ğŸ”¹At an earlier point, events that were not directly related to education and research had already been postponedğŸ”œ. This will now also apply to events that are indeed related to education and research, such as small-scale symposia. Study association activities must also be cancelled, including those of an educational nature. Here too, the four-week period applies. In light of the importance of the study association activities for educationğŸ“š, the related restrictions will be lifted as soon as possibleâœ….

Wow, a lot of (online) events are planned in the upcoming weeksğŸ˜Š. In our stories, you can find a few of them: have discussions at @spui25, look at Marsâ˜„ï¸ with the Anton Pannekoek Institute or, if you are an international student, check out events by ISN Amsterdam!

Explore Amsterdamâ€™s funky street art with Ella and David from @wondrwalk ğŸ‘ Theyâ€™re taking over our Instagram stories today to show you a side of Amsterdam you might not know ğŸ¨ and to tell you a little more about WondrWalk - a student initiative that connects two students together for a corona-proof walk through the city. Itâ€™s a great way to meet a new friend and discover Amsterdam at the same time!

Even though itâ€™s April Foolsâ€™ Day, this is unfortunately not a joke. Itâ€™s time for some action! ğŸ“£ 

On 6 April, students, administrators and staff of all 14 Dutch universities will be congregating to sound the alarmğŸš¨. We will be calling on the new government for an additional 1.1 billion euros that are needed to restore higher education in the Netherlands to a Normal Academic Standard, which has been structurally underfunded due to an increase in students but decrease in ğŸ’° per student. 

The people of Amsterdam agree, do you? Visit the link in our bio for more â„¹ï¸ or to join in.

Election Day - today the Dutch population will choose their government for the next four years.

ğŸ‡³ğŸ‡± Stemmen kan door het hele land, en in Amsterdam staan er een hoop mooie locaties op de kaart. Zo kun je bijvoorbeeld stemmen in het Concertgebouw, het Van Gogh museum en de Melkweg. En, ook ons eigen Bushuis en CREA staan op de kaart! Waar ben jij geweest?
Itâ€™s the final countdown! Who canâ€™t wait to go ice skating ğŸ–.. while youâ€™re waiting, check our story or link in bio to learn more about the physics of ice skating ğŸ’™

title: ğŸŒ·A Quick Tour of Amsterdam
caption:
â–¶ï¸Join urban geographer Willem Boterman on a quick walk through the city while he explains some historical characteristics that in his view define Amsterdam as it is today.

ğŸ‘‰This week the UvA online Open House is all about studying in Amsterdam. Want to know more about studying at the UvA as an international student? Check openhouse.uva.nl

ğŸ—£The themes introduced in the tour are discussed more in depth in the Key Topics in Urban Studies programme, which is part of the online Winter School organised by @amsterdamsummerprograms ğŸ‘ We wish all the UvA Winter School Students a lot of fun and wisdom ğŸ™

Itâ€™s not a classic Amsterdam canal but we think our Science Park campus is pretty stunning in the snow! ğŸ˜
Great ğŸ“¸ by @gewooncaro

â€˜Such a thing doesn't existâ€™, UvA researchers Gadi Rothenberg and Albert Alberts repeatedly heard when they accidentally discovered 100% bioplastic ğŸ’š in 2010. Now ten years later, in collaboration with furniture manufacturer @VepaDrentea, they have created a chair made entirely from plant-based materials. Curious about their story? Read ğŸ‘€ it in the stories!

It's not strange to feel lonely sometimes these days ğŸ˜Œ Wish you could connect more with other students? Joining a student association is a great way to meet other students and join some fun activities! 

Iris Hoornsman, vice chairman of the Amsterdamse Kamer van Verenigingen (the umbrella organisation for Amsterdam student associations), shares why ğŸ’¬:

â€œAlthough it is not possible to come together in groups at this moment, student associations are doing everything they can to stimulate connection between students. Especially now it is important to pay extra attention to each other and to keep in touch with one another. I see many great online initiatives from student associations such as painting workshops, sports lessons, debates, escape rooms and online â€˜borrelsâ€™. In this manner you can be safe at home but you don't have to feel lonely. In addition, most student associations have counselors to whom students can turn to when something is going on. For example when students feel a little low or lonely. There are also activities open to non-members." 

Interested? Check the calendar on www.lidwordeninamsterdam.nl (link in bio) ğŸ“†

title: Timelapse of the construction of the new University Library
caption:
2019, 2020 and 2021 in just a few seconds ğŸ˜± See how the construction of the new University Library progresses. The basement is nearing completion and the contractor is already preparing for the above-ground part of the building. Are you excited to study here in 2023?

@uva_campus @uva_library

title: Coronavirus guidelines on campus
caption: Are you visiting one of the campuses? Make sure you follow the guidelines. Keep a safe distance, wash your hands regularly and follow the indicated routes. âš ï¸
Itâ€™s high time for a P.C. Hoofthuis feature, great ğŸ“¸ by @fierebonner

Interested in going abroad during your studies? ğŸ¤·â€â™€ï¸ Although the coronavirus has halted almost all current student mobility, preparations for the Erasmus and Global Exchange Programme, which will start again in September 2021, are in full swing. 
â¡ï¸ Join the Study Abroad Fair (3-9 October) and find out about exchange, internships and research abroad, summer schools and various (virtual) off-the-beaten-track programmes that can provide you with an international learning experience: www.uva.nl/studyabroad 
ğŸ“¸: Finn Liedtke

title: Humor ğŸ¤£ & politics ğŸ—¯
caption:
Political satire has never been more present than it is today and it can be very effective. Want to know why? Watch our IGTV ğŸ‘€

The Faculty of Social and Behavioral Sciences launched a web page that features research and experts on the Dutch elections and Dutch politics. Want to watch more videos on filterbubbles, framing and deep fakes? Visit the link in our stories. Although the web page is in Dutch, subtitles are available ğŸ™†â€â™€ï¸

ğŸ‘€ Get a glimpse at your fellow UvA studentsâ€™ real life rooms in our photo series, â€˜Gluren bij de Burenâ€™ (ENG: A peek inside your neighbourâ€™s house). This week we visit Guusjeâ€™s room. She's 21 years old and is doing a BA student in Communication Science. 

Guusje: â€œI knew from a young age that I wanted to study in the big city, in Amsterdam. Before I managed to get this room, I lived in the Bijlmer neighbourhood, in the student hotel Casa and in an attic room at the Biesbosstraat. Iâ€™m glad Iâ€™ve finally found a spot that I really love. In this apartment I really feel at home, a feeling that I didn't experience in my previous rooms. During the process of searching for the right room, I sometimes thought: itâ€™ll never happen... But my tip is: donâ€™t give up hope, persistence always wins! ğŸ’ª

Despite the fact that I really love it here, the hanging plant about my table does irritate me. To water it, I need to climb on my wobbly table. (Side note: while doing the interview, the UvA social team was also scared sheâ€™d fall and break some bones ğŸ¤ª). But the plant is too cute to get rid of. My favourite item in my room is right underneath the plant â€“ my wooden dachshund. I have a small collection of dachshund items. This one reminds me of my own miniature dachshund, who is currently living with my parents.â€ ğŸ¾ 

Stats ğŸ“‹
room: 20m2 | location: Rivierenbuurt | price: â‚¬630 (including facilities) | 3 housemates | shared kitchen and bathroom.

UPDATE #coronavirus â—Itâ€™s been a while since we last updated you on the measures and developments concerning the coronavirus at the UvA. You can read about the most recent update here, or on www.uva.nl/coronavirus
ğŸ”¹Both students and study advisers have expressed a need for one-to-one meetings on campus. These are now made possible in some cases if an online meeting does not suffice. Students can consult study advisers about their academic career as well as concerning problems caused by their studies or personal matters that are affecting the latter and their ability to study.
These meetings are by appointmentğŸ•°ï¸. Of course the 1Â½-metre rule will apply and all other measures will remain in place. Students can find further information on study advisers in the A-Z list for their degree programme.
ğŸ”¹If necessary, degree certificatesğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ“ can now be picked up from the reception desk by appointment. The procedure is the same as it was in autumn 2020. The exact details will vary from faculty to faculty and from degree programme to degree programme.
ğŸ”¹We previously reported that we are working hard on preparing for any easing of the restrictions for higher education which might take place at the end of April. This will enable us to make optimum use of any such easing, should it occur. However, this still seems rather uncertain, given the current infection ratesğŸ¦

Whatâ€™s your best memory of your UvA introduction? Comment down below â¬‡ï¸

P.S. Are you a (prospective) UvA student and do you want to help us improve the introductions? Visit our story to give your opinion about the introductions at the UvAğŸ™

P.P.S. @intreeweek is looking for mentors and crew members for the Intreeweek 2021. If youâ€™re interested in giving new UvA students an introduction to remember, take a look at @intreeinside ğŸ˜ƒ
Today is the day Dutch secondary school students find out theyâ€™re graduating ğŸ‰ To everyone who has passed and is graduating - congratulations! Or in Dutch: GEFELICITEERD ğŸ¥³

Guess what we are looking at? This photographer is certainly not afraid of heights ğŸ˜‚

ğŸ—ï¸ Actually, this is de view from a tower crane on the LAB42 building plot at Amsterdam Science Park. LAB42 will become the international hub for talent development in digital innovation and Artificial Intelligence (AI).

ğŸ’š The design of LAB42 is sustainable, circular and energy neutral. Among other things, rainwater will be collected for flushing the toilets. Reusable parts are used as much as possible, so that the building is built in a circular manner.

ğŸŒŒ Fun fact: number 42 in the name refers to the answer to the ultimate question about life, the universe and everything (The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy).

The ambition is to open the building for use in August 2022. Want to find out more about LAB42? Click the link in bio!

ğŸ“¢ Big news! ğŸ“¢ The UvAâ€™s @AllardPierson Museum is reopening this Tuesday (15 September)! Fascinated by mummies, ancient civilisations or Amsterdam history? Donâ€™t miss out on the current exhibitions! (Tip: UvA students and staff can visit for free!) ğŸ‘

title: The Realities of Studying Online |Student Vlogs Month 2  Anna  UvA
caption:
Hey everyone! 

My nameâ€™s Anna, Iâ€™m 23, and Iâ€™m from the US! Over the next two years Iâ€™ll be getting a masterâ€™s in forensic science. Iâ€™m super excited to be participate in this vlog series  and to share my experience with you :) Stay tuned for more videos!

We are incredibly excited to share this new series of student vlogs with you!! Four first-year students have been documenting their experiences of coming to Amsterdam and starting their studies in the fall of 2020. As this academic year looks different compared to others we thought it would be interesting to see how students are experiencing this change. 

#StudentVlog #Universitylife #UniversityofAmsterdam

ğŸ‘€ Get a glimpse at your fellow UvA studentsâ€™ real life rooms in our photo series, â€˜Gluren bij de Burenâ€™ (ENG: A peek inside your neighbourâ€™s house). This week we visit Mattâ€™s (28) apartment. Heâ€™s an international MA student in Communication Science from the US. Although our previous housing examples show that preparation is key in finding a room, Matt shows that luck can play a big part as well âœ¨

Matt: â€œMy flatmate and I had an appointment in the city. We showed up five minutes early and saw two people standing outside a building, who just happened to a landlord and real estate agent. After chatting to them, we immediately got a tour around the apartment and that night we got an offer to be the renters of the apartment ğŸ˜± 

Iâ€™ve lived here since January 2020 so Iâ€™ve experienced Amsterdam in a really unique time. Living in the city centre is very convenient, location wise, but if I have to name something which I get annoyed by itâ€™s for sure the church bells ringing every 15 minutes ğŸ”” They are beautiful, don't get me wrong, but there are times when I want to sleep but I canâ€™t. My best option are my earplugs although they also donâ€™t work all the time. An advantage, however, is that Iâ€™m always very aware of the time ğŸ˜‰â€ 

Stats ğŸ“‹
83m2 apartment (room: 9m2) | location: city centre (Jewish neighborhood) | price: â‚¬825 (excluding utilities) | 1 roommate | shared bathroom, kitchen, living room.

ğŸ  We've never spent so much time in so few square meters. We're curious where you're spending your time! For a new photo series about student housing in Amsterdam, we're looking for students who want to show their room (or house). Interested? A professional photographer will capture you and your room on Wednesday the 26th of May. Visit our stories for more info ğŸ‘€

title: Professor Damiaan Denys wins Ig Nobel Prize
caption: Congratulations to professor Damiaan Denys @amsterdam_umc for winning the Ig Nobel Prize! ğŸ‰ğŸ¥³ğŸŠ The prize is awarded each year to research that makes people laugh at first, and then makes them think. Professor Denys' team researched and first labeled the term 'mysofonia', a condition in which specific sounds, such as sneazing or rustling of paper can lead to disgust or aggressionğŸ˜¤. In this video, Damiaan Denys describes his research and how he came in contact with it ğŸ†.

title: Joining Student Organizations at the UvA|Student Vlogs Month 3  Anna  UvA
caption:
Hey everyone! 

My nameâ€™s Anna, Iâ€™m 23, and Iâ€™m from the US! Over the next two years Iâ€™ll be getting a masterâ€™s in forensic science. Iâ€™m super excited to be participate in this vlog series  and to share my experience with you :) Stay tuned for more videos!

We are incredibly excited to share this new series of student vlogs with you!! Four first-year students have been documenting their experiences of coming to Amsterdam and starting their studies in the fall of 2020. As this academic year looks different compared to others we thought it would be interesting to see how students are experiencing this change. 

#StudentVlog #Universitylife #UniversityofAmsterdam

Studiekeuze-inspiratie: Gezondheid en Leven ğŸŒ±ğŸ’‰

Kun je met kunstmatige intelligentie straks foutloze medische diagnoses stellen? Mag je straks zonder vaccinatie naar een festival? Kan het bloed in een mug als forensisch bewijs dienen? Laat je verrassen door onze diverse studies in het UvA Open Huis, dit keer op het gebied van Gezondheid en Leven. 

Kijken welke opleiding bij jou past? Of je aanmelden voor een live sessie? Check onze IG stories of link in bio ğŸ’ƒ

ğŸ¤©ğŸ˜®

Great ğŸ“¸ by:@reinwieringa

Today is Blue MondayğŸ’™ğŸŸ¦ğŸ”·ğŸ”µ, usually known as the most depressing day of the year. We dug into our archives for a blue look on Amsterdamâ€¦ 

Some of our professors have their own outlook on Blue Monday. Their insightsğŸ’¡:

Reinout Wiers, professor of Developmental Psychopathology and co-director of the Centre for Urban Mental HealthğŸ’¬: â€˜Almost half of the people meet lifetime criteria for a mental disorder; most prevalent are anxiety, depression and addictions. On Blue Monday, or another blue day during lockdown, this may be bearable, because we're all in the same boat. It becomes difficult when everyone else is having fun, and you can only watch through your window or telephone-screen.â€™

Claudi Bockting, professor in Clinical Psychology and co-director of the Centre for Urban Mental HealthğŸ’¬: Blue Monday is made up by advertising agencies to sell more sun vacations. There are effective treatments for depression and anxiety; a sun holiday is not amongst them. Interdisciplinary research, as executed in the Center for Urban Mental Health at our university, is crucial to achieve a breakthrough in this field.â€™

This message is aimed at Dutch-speaking students of the UvA.
 
Ben je een Masterstudent of Derdejaars Bachelorstudent aan de FGW, FMG of FEB van de UvA met een niet-westerse migratie-achtergrond? Wil je beginnen aan een oriÃ«ntatie op de arbeidsmarkt en ben je op zoek naar een sparringspartner? Wil je sneller aan een passende baan komen met inzichten van een mentor die weet wat jouw niet-westerse migratie-achtergrond waard is? Meld je dan aan voor Meet Your Mentor, het nieuwe online mentoringprogramma van de UvA, dat studenten met een niet-westerse migratie-achtergrond ondersteunt in hun overgang naar de arbeidsmarkt. ğŸ’¼ Het programma duurt 6 maanden en je bent er minimaal 12 uur in totaal mee bezig.
 
Meld je aan voor 16 oktober 2020! â°
 
ğŸ‘†Check onze stories voor meer informatie, of ga naar www.meetyourmentor.nl

ğŸ‘‹ Meet Aleksandra and Simone! Theyâ€™re part of @HeForShexUvA, a student association founded last year, which is focused on creating a discussion around (gender) equality. It is a student chapter of the UN global movement for gender equality, striving to include all genders in feminism.

Want to know more? Aleksandra and Simone are taking over our IG stories today! You can also visit @heforshexuva ğŸ‘

UPDATE #coronavirusâ—The current coronavirus measures will be extended by three weeks. This means that the measures currently in place for teaching at the UvA will also be extended until (at least) 9 February 2021. Keep on reading or check our link in bio for the update. 
ğŸ”¹In 2021, we will continue to work and study from homeğŸ  for the time being. Everyone should work or study from home unless this is genuinely impossible. To make working and studying from home a little easier, we have listed all the working-from-home tips once again. Students can get support from study advisers or a student psychologist and find general tips in the A-Z list.
ğŸ”¹The mandate to study from home has put a strain on social contact between studentsğŸ‘¥, at a time when we just might need each other more than ever. The Executive Board is aware of this issue and has allocated funding to help the UvA promote socially distanced social interaction between students in 2021. We are doing this through the Keep in Touch campaign. Study associations can submit ideasğŸ’¡ for consideration until 31 January 2021. 
ğŸ”¹Study places for vulnerable students are available in the University Library. The places can only be used if you book in advance. Find out whether you are eligible via the library. 
ğŸ”¹The University Library on Singel is open for returning and borrowing booksğŸ“š. The information desk on the first floor is open daily from 09:00 to 18:00. The other University Library branches are closed.

ğŸ‘€ Get a glimpse at your fellow UvA studentsâ€™ real life rooms in our photo series, â€˜Gluren bij de Burenâ€™ (ENG: A peek inside your neighbourâ€™s house). This week weâ€™re visiting Shirinâ€™s room in the final part of our student housing photo series. Sheâ€™s 20 years old and a BA student in Media and Culture from Munich (Germany). She got her room via UvA Housing. 

Shirin: "I was a bit anxious when I decided to go to Amsterdam and find a place on my own. It felt weird to go from being around my family all the time to live in a room alone. I feel very lucky to get a spot in student housing where all my roommates have the same vibes and energy as I do. We have a shared kitchen and hang out there (or in each otherâ€™s room) a lot. Youâ€™re never really alone here. 

ğŸ‘‰ My advice for international students who want to apply for UvA Housing: get an overview of the districts in Amsterdam and decide where you want to live. When the application opens, be quick and make sure you're on time. If youâ€™re not applying via UvA Housing, be aware of Facebook scams. The whole process can sometimes be a little bit confusing but push through and never give up! Iâ€™m so happy Iâ€™m here now ğŸ˜Šâ€

Stats ğŸ“‹
Room (with private bathroom): 14m2 | location: DeKey Nieuw-West | price: â‚¬509 (including facilities) | 10 hallmates | shared kitchen.

title: Starting My Studies  Student Vlogs Week 2  OisÃ­n  UvA
caption:
Hey everyone! 

My name is OisÃ­n and I am 18 years old coming from Dublin, Ireland. I worked as a lifeguard for the past year before deciding to move to Amsterdam. #CYBERSECURITY UPDATE: UvA & AUAS repel cyber attack
â¡ï¸ The serious cyber attack on the UvA and AUAS did not result in any system failures, hijacking or ransom requests. 

â¡ï¸ During the past few weeks, all of the UvA and AUAS servers have been thoroughly investigated and cleaned up where necessary - the acute danger has passed.

â¡ï¸ The attack and the AUAS and UvAâ€™s response to it will be extensively evaluated in the coming weeks.

â¡ï¸ Check our story or link in bio for the full update!

Say ğŸ‘‹ to Seung Ju Kim (19), a BA student Psychology at the UvA. In her podcast @voiced_vulnerabilities she talks about mental health and shares her personal experiences with it.

ğŸ’­ Seung Ju Kim: â€œAfter moving to a new country and transitioning into university, Iâ€™ve struggled a lot with mental health and loneliness. I knew that I wasnâ€™t the only one - I couldnâ€™t be; and Iâ€™ve always been keen on bringing more awareness around it. I love podcasts and how soothing they are to listen to, and I thought it was a great idea to start my own to raise more awareness for mental health. What I hope for the podcast is to provide a safe space for others to open up since youâ€™re never alone in feeling like this. I experienced that the podcast allows others to be able to address their struggles and Iâ€™d love to see more people know that itâ€™s normal to talk about it.â€ 

Visit the link in bio to find your way to the podcast ğŸ¶
